column5: Looking forward to gaming with my friends in person. Sitting down with a beer and playing board games or rocket league.
In a world of uncertainty and troubling times I‚Äôve been able to keep my job.
Did anyone else read this as Chere lock?
Gotta get the bread and the milk
Lion King theme immediately starts playing

Yeah they know. It‚Äôs just a struggle to balance their ability to do everything anxiety free and me holding them back when we‚Äôre out together. I appreciate how supportive you‚Äôve been and appreciate the lense you‚Äôve shown it through

Yep and thinking about all the fun things you have and will miss just makes you even more anxious. You feel like a fuck up because no one else crumples in anxiety at any slight situation. It sucks. Today I‚Äôm feeling the self pity party. Here‚Äôs to hoping tomorrow is a better day for both of us where we can face it
Amen. This a 1000 times over
Both. Vraylar, lamictal and guanfacine. It‚Äôs off and on so not too bad

I seem to have the opposite reaction with bupropion where that‚Äôs how I feel on it. Not positive though it‚Äôs not outside circumstances. Sorry you feel this way and good luck remembering your meds!!!
So true but as someone else said: it‚Äôs more like go out, hate it and freak out, come home and be depressed that you couldn‚Äôt do it

Something I find useful is remembering that everyone would find your situation of a new job anxiety producing. Knowing I‚Äôm supposed to have some anxiety makes me feel better and not get in my head as much even though it‚Äôs more anxiety than most folks have. 

Remember you‚Äôve got this!!!

My partner and I go to bed at different times, he usually later by a few hours. It works for us. Sorry to hear your in a tough spot. My personal opinion is you should be telling a grown ass man that 5-6am is unacceptable, especially when it messes with your sleep. The only caveat is if he works 3rd shift. Then I understand why he‚Äôs staying up so late.

Short answer: Yes

Long Answer: I find that sometimes, like you, I can be fine and other times it triggers a negative down spiral of thoughts. I was drinking almost every day (a beer or two max) and found when I stopped doing that the same thing happened too for a day.

That‚Äôs a wonderful way to put that and I feel like I know exactly what you‚Äôre talking about. I‚Äôm not depressed but I‚Äôm not happy. I‚Äôm not having anxiety attacks but I‚Äôm still really anxious. It applies to a lot of things and I like the way you said it.
I know what you mean. Wanting the best parts of Hyde with the stability of Jekyll. That‚Äôs my dream goal.
Fingers crossed
Love it!
I‚Äôll have to ask my prescribed about it next time I see them!

I unfortunately can not tolerate SSRIs. I have tried pretty much all of them under the sun and they all give me roughly the same side effect profile with the same bad results :(. I appreciate the input though!

I suffer similar issues but career focused rather than gym focused. I find I lack a lot of the motivation others have to succeed and that I‚Äôm fine just plodding along.

I have never tried a stimulant or adderall specifically. I don‚Äôt know whether it would help or not. I know that most doctors are hesitant to prescribe stimulants to those of us with BP because it can easily trigger (hypo)mania. I am looking to start some form of ADHD med for my own reasons so I‚Äôll loop back to this post if it‚Äôs a stimulant and let you know since I‚Äôm also on lamictal. 

Best of luck and I hope things get better for you

I agree with a few of your points. What makes it work for me is a lot of hard work on my part through self reflection etc... I find the more I‚Äôm in touch with what‚Äôs going on the easier it is to make the relationship work because I know things like ‚ÄúI want to go out and fuck anyone because I‚Äôm hyper sexual from hypomania‚Äù aren‚Äôt ‚Äúreal‚Äù but just a product of what‚Äôs going on chemistry wise. Very tough don‚Äôt get me wrong but just being aware like you are is half the battle I think.

As others have said, meds make things much easier, stabler, and overall a better experience. What they don‚Äôt do is take everything away. There‚Äôs still plenty to work on in therapy and your own to handle the ups and downs life throws at you but that‚Äôs true of anyone. Meds just give us the ability to be on a more level playing field when dealing with those ups and downs.

Also as someone else said, I 110% post here when I‚Äôm struggling. I comment when I‚Äôm doing well. It skews what you see on the page. You‚Äôll see mostly bad things but positive comments in my opinion.

I hear you loud and clear. I don‚Äôt necessarily have experience with someone who isn‚Äôt capable of opening up. The 2 people I dated that fit this description both seemed secure enough to be open and express themselves. Long story short, they were both ‚Äúboring‚Äù to me but that wasn‚Äôt a bad thing nor was that the reason the relationship ended. Good luck friend and most of all, have fun!
I wish I did but I only have PS4. Jump on the discord and ask maybe?

I appreciate the advice. I currently do both medication and therapy it‚Äôs more a matter of do I stick with my current medications that seem to be working really well except for this one thing and work on it with therapy or do I advocate for change? I wanted perspective of what other people have dealt with.
I think that‚Äôs a good way to look at it. Meds have helped slow it down so I can recognize it. Now it‚Äôs just fighting it.

Thanks. Maybe they are delusions? The other day I wanted to talk to a friend about it and I thought the apartment was bugged so I had to do it in the car so that probably counts. It really depends on the day or week how bad it is. I just don‚Äôt know where to draw the line at a med problem or a me problem.
I can‚Äôt distinguish between what‚Äôs normal paranoia that‚Äôs something I should try and deal with as therapy and what‚Äôs I should try to address with meds.
I find journaling helps a lot!

I just posted similar and saw this. I don‚Äôt have the delusions per se but I have a ton of paranoia surrounding my partners behaviors too like ‚Äúwhat are they really doing‚Äù, ‚Äúdo they love me‚Äù, and other things like that. I know that deep down it‚Äôs probably has to do with self esteem stuff showing up as paranoia but the short version of this post is... I feel you!

I think everyone struggles with these thoughts. The doubt and concern over whether it‚Äôs hypomania or not and we forget to give ourselves permission to be happy because we are so worried that happy/good could be hypomania. At least, I still struggle with that after a few years of being diagnosed.
Vraylar seems to be a miracle drug for everyone I talk to. I‚Äôm so glad it‚Äôs working for you too!

As someone else replied to this, I‚Äôve heard trazadone is a nightmare when it comes to appetite increase. Lamictal is supposed to be weight neutral. I can vouch that I‚Äôve only gained a pound or two on it so it mostly lives up to that claim. Fluoxetine may also make you gain a little weight just because it‚Äôs an SSRI and they‚Äôre known for doing that as a class of drug overall. Not sure whether it is specifically known for doing that or not but SSRIs are for sure.

I‚Äôll back up /u/MedicalEnigma4. Started out as severe depressive episodes and anxiety for me as a kid. Then I don‚Äôt know about for them but for me I then started getting the ups about my mid to late teens. Every summer I would get the hypomanic stages and then I‚Äôd crash. Took me almost 15 years to get diagnosed. Where I agree with MedicalEnigma again is the meds take a long time to get sorted out. Took almost 2 years to get the cocktail of meds sorted out. Also, where I agree again is you need a psych you can trust. Mine is awesome. Without her knowledge, I wouldn‚Äôt have found the meds that work.

That‚Äôs really interesting. I‚Äôd trust your gut (side note: I‚Äôm a big proponent of trusting your gut) and believe it‚Äôs the Vraylar and not the lithium. The only confounding factor about the first incident is that you had a migraine which could cause some depression like symptoms I imagine. 

I know for me Vraylar pretty much instantly lifted my depression so I imagine if I missed a dose it would instantly stop working too. That‚Äôs my only answer to your question as I‚Äôm not about to skip a dose to find out üòù

Is it an all day thing or just a when you take your pill thing/how often do you take pills? This is probably not the answer you‚Äôre looking for or the answer you want but the only solution I had to a fatigue issue with a medication I was on was to switch. Sorry. The only other thing I can think of is to time it with sleep or lots of coffee?

My vote is see a therapist. Whether you feel like it‚Äôs worth seeing one or not, I think you should. It sounds like all of the things that happened affected your life in various ways. Plus, the worst that happens is that you talk to someone a few times about your life and it turns out you didn‚Äôt need it and you go on your merry way.

I guess I have had good luck. They don‚Äôt necessarily make me lose weight but they are weight neutral (the ones that are supposed to be like Latuda, lamictal, etc...).

Abilify was poor for me. I gained maybe 15 pounds. It wasn‚Äôt as bad as seroquel or some other notorious ones (risperidol was another one for me). I‚Äôm sorry that you‚Äôre going through this. It‚Äôs very tough!
I‚Äôve definitely had poor reactions that have included suicidal thoughts. When this has happened my pdoc has immediately taken me off it so I‚Äôd say get in contact.

I took both. I‚Äôll tell you my experience but remember everyone is different. It stabilized me. I took them for about 9 months. The whole time (I didn‚Äôt really realize it until towards the end and I didn‚Äôt realize the culprit was Latuda) I felt like a zombie without a personality and I felt really dumb (poor word recall, poor cognitive capability etc...). I just recently switched to Vraylar. I still feel stabilized but holy moly do I feel like a different person. I have my personality back, I feel smarter/have my vocabulary back (though I‚Äôve made some dumb mistakes that I attribute to medication based cognitive decline) and I don‚Äôt feel like a zombie. Hopefully the combo works for you in a very successful way. It really helped me in a time of need but without realizing it, it wasn‚Äôt a perfect fit so just be watchful is my advice about this combo and meds in general.
My anxiety has been under control through my other medications and skills. I think the Vraylar has been helping though!
I don‚Äôt know about you but I had no idea that Latuda was having that effect on me. I knew I was dull and personality-less but I never knew it was the Latuda. I have my fingers crossed for you!

I have a weird sort of opposite of this. I forget what depression feels like when I am depressed. I will be depressed and live it for long enough that I forget that there‚Äôs any other way to live. Then I‚Äôll forget what depression feels like and accept it as what normal feels like if that makes sense?

They‚Äôre on the verge of fueling my decision making. I have to put a hard stop to them/really sit down and not let them take over but I can do it. It‚Äôs also not like I‚Äôm all powerful and great like I normally feel, just paranoid so I‚Äôm hoping it really is just me starting to feel good and normal again.

I wouldn‚Äôt say it‚Äôs so much activating as it is less sedating. I took it in the morning at first to not take it on top of the Latuda and the Vraylar didn‚Äôt put me to sleep. I wake up in the morning now rather than fight 30 minutes to wake up. Wouldn‚Äôt say it‚Äôs energizing me, at least not to my knowledge.
No such luck :(
That pizza? The flip side had the places name on it.
Hmmm ü§î now I‚Äôm wondering if this explains why I‚Äôm kind of tired a lot. I appreciate your input!

We‚Äôre you taking it at night and still finding it sedating the next morning? I‚Äôm about to go on it from Latuda. I find that Latuda makes me really sleepy once I take it and harder to wake up but then I‚Äôm fine. Now I‚Äôm a little worried but it‚Äôs a small price to pay for better stability/if it works better as an antidepressant
Best of luck to you! Scary jump but it sounds like you‚Äôve done you‚Äôre research and you‚Äôre prepared. ü§ûfor you!!!

I just had these exact same thoughts myself this week. Some days I have reason to live and be happy, some days I don't. Try to remember those happy things if you can. The medications are hard to get right and to get a stable balance if you're going that route. They do (for me) provide some semblance of stability of balance and I keep trying my hardest to get to a point where they will keep me stable enough that I'm happy every day.
I have definitely started to break out more. I think I tend to have issues with SSRIs though. Lamictal wasn't too bad for me.
Realizing that not everyone has this fear or overwhelming occupation with wanting to die is a huge thing. I‚Äôm glad you‚Äôre in a better space now!

Keep me posted about the vraylar! I‚Äôm curious about how it goes. Someday they‚Äôll have a miracle cure but until then we‚Äôll have to learn to live with the symptoms and fighting it our own separate ways between drugs and our brains. Hopefully we all find a way that works!
Seriously! A) Where do I sign up for one? B) What‚Äôs that like?

Walking is my go to like someone else said. I try to walk the dog even if it‚Äôs 5 or 10 min at least it‚Äôs something. Dog appreciates it too. Then I try to capitalize on that by using it to jump start something else but I know it can be tough to keep it going or get started at all. Good luck and just keep trying the best that you can!

I feel like I‚Äôm dealing with that right now. Stick with it as best you can. You‚Äôre doing the first part which is recognizing it and the second part which is seeing your psych. Just keep doing your best in the meantime!
I do too and I know it‚Äôs out there it just seems so far away right now. It seemed so close only months ago but now it‚Äôs like I‚Äôm at the bottom of the hill again. I appreciate it.
Thanks and suicidal ideation
Two mood stabilizers, an anti psychotic and an anti anxiety med.
I am on lamictal, latuda, clonidine and topirimate. I‚Äôm coming off setraline which has been an absolute mess (both being on it and coming off) so I feel you right now being all angry and such!

WhiteChocolate (sorry for the misspelling) said it. It‚Äôs hard to be on meds but I‚Äôve found that trying to be on meds and find the right one is just as hard or less hard than not being on meds. At least trying to be on meds feels like I‚Äôm trying where as not is just a constant struggle with no effort.

Obsession over things and buying useless things I don‚Äôt need. Damn amazon is the bane of my existence when I‚Äôm hypo. I actually had to cancel prime and delete my credit card info from there to stop me and even that has only worked some. Also hyper sexuality for sure.

Yes I‚Äôm on both lamictal and latuda right now too. My doc was also very hesitant about putting me on sertraline but we‚Äôre trying all we can because of my depression. I learned the hard way before I was diagnosed not to do a SSRI or SNRI by itself :(
I had a lot of hair loss when I took it

I‚Äôm on 200mg. It‚Äôs not a life saver like some have said but it definitely helps. Makes everything stable. Doesn‚Äôt get rid of the depression but stabilizes so the lows aren‚Äôt rock bottom low and the highs don‚Äôt get me in trouble.

Yep. I feel irritated all the time but it‚Äôs when I‚Äôm coming off meds usually. Otherwise I‚Äôm usually just depressed and a door mat. I just want to kill everyone when I‚Äôm that angry and irritated though. I hope it‚Äôs just a side effect and goes away for you soon.
I hear you loud and clear. I hate my birthday. Mine times of with seasonal depression too but I hate it regardless. Don‚Äôt know how to describe why I hate it but I relate to you.
‚ÄúI must really love you because he was black, cute and rich.‚Äù Said by my black girlfriend. I‚Äôm white. I get what her drunk self was trying to say but boy did that one sting.
No problem! Also thanks for all your support!
Suicidal ideation.

That was very helpful. I relate to a lot of that. Having a lot of things together, financially, emotionally, and just overall. Right now and for the last month or two I‚Äôve just been spiraling out of control. My drinking is way up. My SI is up and I‚Äôm feeling all of these things I‚Äôm feeling. I‚Äôm just going to keep hoping that through hard work and keeping with what has been helping it gets better on the other end.
I feel better when I play guitar which I love but it doesn‚Äôt necessarily energize me. It does help immensely though!
I don‚Äôt disagree with you though physically I feel fine ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
What was your relapse like? I feel like I‚Äôm maybe hitting mine
Thank you for that. A small victory is what I needed. Feels nothing like losses right now

Do you think it‚Äôs that your personality left with being diagnosed bipolar or because you‚Äôre taking care of your bipolar? I feel like my personality is leaving because I‚Äôm taking care of my bipolar, like my bipolar was my personality. 

My girlfriend does love me. It hurts her that I‚Äôm not open. It‚Äôs on me that I‚Äôm not. I‚Äôve just got a mental block not to be. Like I‚Äôm damaged goods and by saying it out loud it makes it true.

I appreciate it. I think you‚Äôre right about self medicating though I don‚Äôt really know about what. 

I also think you‚Äôre right that I‚Äôm grieving too

I appreciate your support!

I‚Äôve never done intensive OP or inpatient ever. I‚Äôve come close to sending myself inpatient a few times but never gone over the edge. I‚Äôm just struggling to accept that I feel like a husk of a person compared to the vibrant person I can be... even though I know it‚Äôs hypomania

I‚Äôve been on my meds for a while now. Probably 9 months. Almost a year and a half for some of them. They‚Äôre like 70 to 80% effective. Just trying to get them fine tuned and it‚Äôs not going so well.

We‚Äôve been together 8 months now. Long enough that I‚Äôm ‚Äúsupposed‚Äù to be open about this kind of thing.
Lol you go girl!
It‚Äôs tough. I wouldn‚Äôt be in half this predicament if I didn‚Äôt hide it but alas here I am. I appreciate the support!

If only hypomania came without the sexual mishaps and the crazy overspending. That and be perpetually run down 24/7 but still feeling ramped up. I‚Äôd be game for that because boy do I know how you feel.

The withdrawal is brutal. Mine was ‚Äúeasy‚Äù compared to most. I quit cold turkey once and titrated down after a month on it again. Both times I felt horrible. Headaches, didn‚Äôt know where I was, blacking out, felt nauseous, and other lovely effects. Best of luck. If you can go as slow as you possibly can. I heard it suggested you break open the capsule and take out one bead at a time.
My first (and only tattoo) was during a hypomania phase. I didn‚Äôt know at the time I had bipolar or that it was hypomania but looking back 110%

I take lamictal along with topirimate (for appetite suppression), Latuda for depression, and clonidine for anxiety. I‚Äôm starting and in the process of upping sertraline for depression too because I‚Äôm still fairly low. I found lamictal not even close to enough on its own though it definitely helps stabilize so I can take an SSRI
Haha I hear you. Had the passing urge to go get another tattoo or a piercing which is the equivalent (it‚Äôs socially acceptable for me to buzz my hair)

I unfortunately don‚Äôt have any advice for taking them regularly, I just do. I know that when I‚Äôm either feeling really down or really up, I want to stop taking them. I want to chuck them out the window because it feels like they‚Äôre not working and what‚Äôs the point if they‚Äôre not working? Same thing if the side effects are kicking in pretty bad and they‚Äôre not working that well. Are either of those situations a problem? If so the best I can say is keep trying to find a medication that works for you and tough it out. It took me the best part of a year and a half, almost 2 to find a cocktail that works well for me (still fine tuning it to be honest) and it was a slog. Sheer will and determination were what kept me taking the pills sometimes and knowing that it would eventually help. It‚Äôs not easy by any means. Keep trying as best you can. Any little bit helps!

I‚Äôve never been delusional from sleep deprivation. It‚Äôs embarrassing though knowing you see l, hear, or feel something that no one else does and it‚Äôs not real. It‚Äôs so much safer when you can escape from that.

It‚Äôs amazing what a regular sleep schedule will do and motivating yourself to get up and go can do. Sometimes it‚Äôs so hard though when the first thing that happens when you wake up is hearing that voice say ‚Äúkill yourself‚Äù. 

I will say I hear you loud and clear on vacation. I just recently went on one and it was SO stressful. All I wanted to do was sleep and not explore at all. Took so much effort to go out and do things.
Mine snuck up on me. It wasn‚Äôt until a day ago I realized as I was talking it out that it had become a problem and that I agreed with all of this.
If it keeps you alive sometimes it‚Äôs a necessary evil. I know it‚Äôs not healthy but as some of those point out in a way, it‚Äôs better than being dead or torturing yourself with your mind.
Yes or being asleep is the only way to be alive is how I see it. I‚Äôm spending the majority of these last two weeks asleep when I‚Äôm not working.
Keep fighting as best you can. I imagine that‚Äôs incredibly tough to do without facing any struggles and only tougher facing our struggles.
Seconded. Everyone supporting each other is what helps us get through the tough times and the slightly too good times.

Oh man! So happy to know I wasn‚Äôt alone when it came to strattera side effects. That tingling feeling was the worst. Mine was in my tailbone. Made me feel like there was a fire in my tailbone and sometimes I had to lay done in a fetal position to let it pass!

I was helping my friend through his first Kings fall raid with an LFG. About 3/4 of the way through one guy shouts over his mic ‚ÄúCan‚Äôt honey, saving the world from this bitch Oryx. Maybe later.‚Äù Reminded me of this.
Thank you. It seems to have passed. That stupid ‚ÄúThis too shall pass‚Äù is right again even if it never helps in the moment.
I‚Äôll try that idea tomorrow. They‚Äôre currently sleeping on the couch. Probably smarter to let them cool off first. Thank you for the support!
